properties.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued February 8 at 2:34AM PST until February 8 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
* WHAT....For the High Surf Advisory, large waves and dangerous
surf conditions expected. Breakers up to 23 feet. For the
Coastal Flood Advisory, minor tidal overflow flooding expected.
Total tide near 10.5 feet around noon Saturday.

* WHERE...North Oregon Coast.

* WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 7 PM PST this evening.
For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 4 PM PST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow
flooding is expected. Coastal residents in the warned area
should be alert for rising water, and take appropriate action to
protect life and property. A High Surf Advisory means that high
surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing rip
currents and localized beach erosion.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Sneaker waves can surge high up the beach
without warning, catching an inattentive individual off guard.
These waves can move with great speed further up the beach than
you expect. No place on the beach is too high for a wave to
reach.
properties.instruction:
A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in
the advisory area, producing rip currents and localized beach
erosion.

A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow flooding is
expected. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert
for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and
property.

NWSheadline: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY FOR TIDAL OVERFLOW NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST SATURDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST SATURDAY EVENING
